Docs.summary: Defines constants that specify the content flow direction for text and [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ui](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-ui-md.md)] elements.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The flow direction of content typically corresponds to the innate flow direction of the language being represented. Hebrew and Arabic provide examples of languages that naturally flow from right-to-left. English, German, and Russian provide examples of languages that naturally flow from left-to-right.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the FlowDirection enumeration to set the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Block.FlowDirection%2A> attribute of a flow content <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Block> element (<xref:System.Windows.Documents.Paragraph>).
